alert.note: Alert for Cameron; Clinton; Lycoming; Potter; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 2:59PM EDT until July 24 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Cameron County in north central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Clinton County in north central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Lycoming County in north central Pennsylvania... Southern Potter County in north central Pennsylvania... Southwestern Tioga County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 258 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Keating Summit to Sizerville to Truman, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Wellsboro, Cameron, Wharton, Coudersport, Emporium, Galeton, Gaines, Cross Fork, Hicks Run, Leonard Harrison State Park, Denton Hill State Park and Tamarack. This includes the following highways... Route 6 between west of Coudersport and Coudersport, and from east of Coudersport to Wellsboro. State Road 120 from near Truman to north of Driftwood. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Widespread wind damage has already occurred with these storms.
